statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Justin Johnson scored 23 points and Western Kentucky won consecutive NIT games for the first time since 1948 with a 79-75 victory over USC on Monday night.

video.headline: Bearden, Johnson fundamental basketball leads to slam for Hilltoppers
video.caption: Justin Johnson passes to Lamonte Bearden and he lobs it up to Johnson for the nice alley-oop slam.
video.description: Justin Johnson passes to Lamonte Bearden and he lobs it up to Johnson for the nice alley-oop slam.
video.title: Bearden, Johnson fundamental basketball leads to slam for Hilltoppers

article.headline: WKU wins consecutive NIT games for 1st time since 1948

images.name: Bearden, Johnson fundamental basketball leads to slam for Hilltoppers
images.caption: Justin Johnson passes to Lamonte Bearden and he lobs it up to Johnson for the nice alley-oop slam.

article.linkText: WKU wins consecutive NIT games for 1st time since 1948
article.story: LOS ANGELES -- Justin Johnson scored 23 points and Western Kentucky won consecutive NIT games for the first time since 1948 with a 79-75 victory over USC on Monday night. Johnson spun in the paint and hit his patented hook shot with 1:03 remaining to give WKU a 76-73 lead and after Nick Rakocevic answered with a layup, Johnson went 1 of 2 at the free-throw line at 33.1. USC freshman Jordan Usher air-balled a 3-pointer with 24.2 left and the Trojans didn't foul, allowing Dwight Coleby to seal it with a dunk at 11.3. Coleby finished with 13 points, Lamonte Bearden had 11 and Josh Anderson 10 for WKU (26-10), which plays Oklahoma State in the quarterfinals on Wednesday night. WKU extended its made 3-pointer streak to 974 consecutive games, dating to March 15, 1987, for fifth-longest in the nation behind UNLV, Vanderbilt, Duke and Arkansas. Elijah Stewart led USC (24-12) with four 3-pointers and 20 points. ---- More AP college basketball: https://collegebasketball.ap.org; https://twitter.com/AP-Top25 and https://www.podcastone.com/ap-sports-special-events

videos.headline: Mclaughlin, Stewart get the crowd on their feet with crazy slam
videos.description: Jordan McLaughlin throws the alley-oop lob from near half-court to Elijah Stewart for the jam.

videos.headline: Crazy sequence leads to Western Kentucky dunk
videos.description: After fighting for the loose ball, Darius Thomson recovers it for for the Hilltoppers and feeds it Justin Johnson for the slam.

videos.headline: Trojans' Usher pulls off old school move for the bucket
videos.description: Jordan Usher drives to the rim and makes a smooth finger-roll off the glass for the and-1 bucket.

videos.headline: Stewart hits the buzzer-beater
videos.description: Jordan McLaughlin hits Elijah Stewart in the corner and he drains the 3-pointer for the Trojans as the quarter ends.

videos.headline: Stewart, McLaughlin taking over
videos.description: Jordan McLaughlin finds Elijah Stewart again for another triple.
